name: Muslim Community Network
mission: We are dedicated to using civic education and leadership development to shape the public narrative about what it means to be Muslim in America.

geographicCoverage: Brooklyn (Kings County, New York, United States)
New York City (New York, United States)

theoryOfChange: The Muslim Community Network (MCN) explicitly states that their day-to-day activities are aligned with their 'theory of change' and target their vision for long-term social impact. This framework guides their visioning, goal-setting, and ongoing assessment of results for each MCN initiative and the organization as a whole. They clarify their vision of impact, then define measurable, progressive results for each outcome target, aiming to achieve long-range, life-changing, and systems-changing outcomes. This approach is detailed within their 2021 Annual Report, which is linked from their website.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://mcnny.org/donate (Source: https://mcnny.org/donate)

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 27/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, domestic poverty cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data; moderate program ratio (≥65%)
components.improvement_suggestion: Track and report beneficiary counts to enable cost analysis
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Build working capital reserves to 1-3 months of operating expenses

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes for 3+ years

judge_issues.message: BBB name 'Inner-City Muslim Action Network' may not match 'Muslim Community Network' (similarity: 40%)

score_details.score_summary: MCN earns 50/100 due to moderate alignment and moderate impact, with zakat compliance. Evidence score may reflect limited reporting capacity, not program weakness.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://mcnny.org/donate (Source: https://mcnny.org/donate)

all_citations.claim: MCN reported total revenue of $768,698 and a program expense ratio of 72.9%.
The organization is zakat-eligible and accepts donations for its community programs.
MCN provides multiple giving methods for donors to support its mission of civic engagement.
MCN holds a 98.0/100 score with a fundraising efficiency of $0.05 per $1 raised and 8.2 months of working capital.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: MCN earns a moderate overall score reflecting a balance between exceptional financial health and transparency against a need for more robust external impact verification.
areas_for_improvement: Limited direct impact data regarding cost per beneficiary
Opportunity to increase program expense ratio toward industry leading benchmarks

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows medium donor fit for those seeking to support domestic poverty and civic representation causes [4]. Its mission to develop Muslim leadership aligns with community needs, and its verified zakat-eligible status provides a clear pathway for faith-based giving [2][3].
dimension_explanations.impact: MCN focuses on capacity building through its core programs, maintaining a program expense ratio of 72.9% [1][4]. While the organization demonstrates high financial stability with 8.2 months of working capital, specific data regarding the cost per beneficiary is not currently available [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: MCN empowers Muslim Americans through civic education and leadership development to reshape public narratives and foster community engagement.
strengths: High financial accountability with a Charity Navigator score of 98.0/100
Strong fundraising efficiency, spending only $0.05 to raise every $1
Robust liquidity with 8.2 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: MCN is a non-profit organization dedicated to shaping the public narrative of Muslims in America through youth leadership, community education, and civic engagement programs [1][4]. The organization is recognized as zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations through its community-focused initiatives [2].

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization is actively tracking outcomes through Candid and maintains high financial transparency to mitigate governance risks.
risk_factors: <cite id="22">Geographic focus limited to New York City</cite>
case_against.summary: The primary limitation is the <cite id="15">absence of rigorous external impact evaluations</cite> and specific beneficiary data.

confidence.notes: Strong financial and governance data available; impact data is self-reported.

alignment.explanation: MCN offers <cite id="6">verified zakat eligibility</cite> and serves the <cite id="21">domestic poverty cause area</cite>, which is a high-priority but often underserved space for Muslim donors.

credibility.explanation: MCN is highly credible, evidenced by its <cite id="7">Candid Platinum Seal</cite> and <cite id="12">independent board oversight</cite>. Donors can trust the <cite id="18">audited financial transparency</cite> and high accountability ratings.
credibility.improvement: To further enhance credibility, MCN could <cite id="19">pursue a full BBB Wise Giving Alliance review</cite> to meet all 20 standards of accountability.

impact.explanation: The organization operates efficiently with an <cite id="10">72.9% program ratio</cite>. However, the impact score is moderated by a <cite id="15">lack of published cost-per-beneficiary metrics</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact scores would improve by <cite id="20">tracking and reporting specific beneficiary counts</cite> to enable more rigorous cost-effectiveness analysis.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to invest in the long-term civic infrastructure of the American Muslim community and value high financial transparency.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat through domestic community development
Value organizations with low fundraising overhead
Prioritize civic engagement and youth leadership
Prefer supporting established New York-based institutions
giving_considerations: Focus is on long-term narrative change rather than immediate crisis relief
Impact is concentrated in the New York City metropolitan area
Financial health is excellent, but specific beneficiary metrics are still developing
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking international emergency relief or those who require randomized controlled trial (RCT) evidence for all programs.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: MCN tracks <cite id="14">three outcome metrics</cite> and has a clear theory of change, but lacks independent external evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: MCN uses civic education and leadership development to empower Muslims to participate in public life, thereby reshaping the narrative and securing community rights.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that civic engagement programs actually lead to increased political participation and narrative shifts.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="24">3-year revenue CAGR of 10.9%</cite> and expanding programs, MCN has the capacity to absorb more funding for city-wide scaling.

strengths.detail: MCN maintains a <cite id="8">98/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting high standards in governance and financial health.
The organization spends only <cite id="4">$0.05 to raise every $1</cite>, ensuring that the vast majority of donor contributions are available for mission-critical work.
MCN holds <cite id="9">8.2 months of working capital</cite> in working capital, providing significant organizational stability.

strengths_deep_dive: MCN's financial health is anchored by its <cite id="9">robust working capital ratio</cite>, which far exceeds the industry standard for small nonprofits. This stability is paired with a <cite id="10">program expense ratio of 72.9%</cite>, indicating that funds are directed efficiently toward its core initiatives like the <cite id="11">MCN Impact Academy and Zakat Fund</cite>. Furthermore, the organization demonstrates strong governance with an <cite id="12">83% independent board</cite> and a <cite id="13">perfect 100 score in Culture & Community</cite> from Charity Navigator.
rich_narrative.summary: The Muslim Community Network (MCN) is a New York-based organization dedicated to <cite id="1">shaping the public narrative of Muslims in America</cite> through civic education and leadership development. Operating primarily in <cite id="2">New York City and Brooklyn</cite>, MCN addresses domestic poverty and social exclusion by empowering youth and community members to engage in the democratic process. The organization reported <cite id="3">total revenue of $768,698</cite> in 2023, maintaining a lean operational structure with <cite id="4">fundraising efficiency of $0.05 per $1 raised</cite>. Beyond its advocacy and education work, MCN provides direct services including <cite id="5">food drives, soup kitchens, and an immigration project</cite>. As a <cite id="6">zakat-eligible institution</cite>, it offers a verified pathway for Muslim donors to fulfill religious obligations while supporting domestic community infrastructure. The organization is recognized for its high transparency, holding a <cite id="7">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite> and a <cite id="8">98/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>.
